Dubai Real Estate: The First Crack in the Immaculate FacadeJanuary 2025: -0.57% drop in Dubai property prices. It’s a small figure, but symbolic — the first decline in 2.5 years of continuous growth.At the same time, developers seem to have ignored the signal: 53 new projects have been launched (+12,400 units).The battle of the titans continues: • Emaar (16.5% of the market) • Damac (15.8%) • Danube (5.3%).Market in numbers: 🔹 14,413 transactions — a record, but 4.6% lower than December 🔹 The secondary market is growing (+15.7%), while primary real estate is declining (-17.7%) 🔹 From ultra-luxury (villa for 425 million) to budget options (studio for 175k) 🔹 Mortgages: +6.8% in new loans despite regulatory restrictions“Dubai is transitioning from a phase of explosive growth to seeking balance,” says Property Monitor.What if January 2025 isn’t the end of the boom, but the start of an era of a sustainable market? A market where investors prefer real assets over castles in the air, and developers focus not on quantity, but on quality?As one analyst from Property Monitor aptly put it: “The era of guaranteed double-digit returns is fading, but opportunities remain — for those who know how to spot them.”

🚨 Ripple forms partnership with UAE day after Binance’s AI deal in Gulf state.  In a significant development for the crypto space, Ripple has secured approval for regulated crypto payments and services in Dubai's International Financial Centre, further establishing the UAE as a global crypto hub  This move comes just a day after Binance announced a major  2 billion deal with an AI investment firm linked to the UAE government  Ripple's CEO emphasized the UAE's strategic position for accommodating the growing crypto industry The Dubai International Finance Centre operates under relaxed regulations and zero taxes on corporate and personal income, attracting entrepreneurs and investors from around the world  The collaboration between crypto giants like Ripple and Binance signifies a shift in focus towards the UAE, particularly as there are ongoing efforts in the US to attract digital asset firms However, the journey hasn't been entirely smooth for Ripple  The company faces legal challenges, including ongoing litigation with the Securities and Exchange Commission due to past securities law compliance issues  Nevertheless, recent developments hint at potential favorable outcomes as some SEC actions against Ripple have been dismissed in light of shifting regulatory attitudes under the new administration As the crypto market continues to evolve, investors should keep a close eye on these developments in the UAE, as well as the performance of XRP amidst market fluctuations  Following the recent rally led by Ripple, the crypto community remains hopeful for recovery, especially in the face of a dynamic legal landscape and market conditions that could impact asset values hashtag#memecoin hashtag#crypto hashtag#solana hashtag#Ethereum hashtag#ai hashtag#bitcoin hashtag#cryptocurrency⚠️ Disclaimer: This analysis is for informational purposes only and should not be considered financial or investment advice

The cost of living in SLO County is shifting. Child demographics are evolving. Unemployment rates tell a deeper story. But without real-time, hyper-local data, how do we ensure philanthropy is meeting the right needs?That’s why CAPSLO’s latest report on Head Start & Early Head Start is so important. It reveals key insights into the challenges and strengths of families in our region—information that directly impacts how nonprofits, donors, and policymakers can respond.At The Community Foundation San Luis Obispo County, we believe in data-driven philanthropy—because the best giving decisions start with facts, not assumptions. That’s why we created the CFSLOCO Data Center—a hub for trusted, local data to guide funding, strategy, and impact.With better insights, we can: * Align grants with emerging needs. * Strengthen nonprofit capacity with data-backed strategies. * Inspire donors to invest in areas of greatest impact.This new CAPSLO report is just one example of how access to the right data can shape a better future for San Luis Obispo County. Username: Financial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto RicoFinancial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto Rico
Post Content:
Hiring civil servants in Puerto Rico has long been a slow and complicated process, often taking months to fill vacancies. A new AI-driven hiring platform, launched through a hashtag#FOMBPR and Government of Puerto Rico-led hashtag#CivilServiceReform pilot program, cut hiring times to just 13 days, filling 339 positions in 7 months. In just seven months, 339 candidates were hired, surpassing expectations. “Civil service is not merely trying to change the compensation processes, but also the recruitment processes, learning processes, evaluation and development of employees, and organizational design. It is a comprehensive reform.” – Arnaldo Cruz, Deputy Executive Director of the FOMB. The program was so successful that it gained national recognition from the National Governors Association, making Puerto Rico a pioneer in AI-driven, skills-based hiring within the public sector. Read the full blog: https://bit.ly/3DF3e90

Dubai Real Estate: The First Crack in the Immaculate FacadeJanuary 2025: -0.57% drop in Dubai property prices. It’s a small figure, but symbolic — the first decline in 2.5 years of continuous growth.At the same time, developers seem to have ignored the signal: 53 new projects have been launched (+12,400 units).The battle of the titans continues: • Emaar (16.5% of the market) • Damac (15.8%) • Danube (5.3%).Market in numbers: 🔹 14,413 transactions — a record, but 4.6% lower than December 🔹 The secondary market is growing (+15.7%), while primary real estate is declining (-17.7%) 🔹 From ultra-luxury (villa for 425 million) to budget options (studio for 175k) 🔹 Mortgages: +6.8% in new loans despite regulatory restrictions“Dubai is transitioning from a phase of explosive growth to seeking balance,” says Property Monitor.What if January 2025 isn’t the end of the boom, but the start of an era of a sustainable market? A market where investors prefer real assets over castles in the air, and developers focus not on quantity, but on quality?As one analyst from Property Monitor aptly put it: “The era of guaranteed double-digit returns is fading, but opportunities remain — for those who know how to spot them.”

Inspired by  Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Vision During Our Dubai Visit Our recent family visit to Dubai left me truly amazed and hashtag#inspired. Standing at the top of hashtag#Burj Khalifa and dining at Atmosphere, I couldn’t help but reflect on how one man’s vision transformed a desert into one of the most sought-after destinations in the world.Sheikh Rashid bin Saeed Al Maktoum’s legacy is not just about the towering skyscrapers or the luxurious lifestyle — it’s about how he uplifted an entire community and positioned Dubai as a global icon.Here are 10 powerful leadership lessons that resonated deeply with me during this trip:✨ 1. Vision Beyond Limitations – Sheikh Rashid envisioned Dubai’s potential even when it was just a small fishing village. Greatness begins with a bold vision.🏆 2. Investing in Infrastructure – From Jebel Ali Port to the expansion of Dubai Creek, his focus on infrastructure laid the foundation for global success.💡 3. Diversification of hashtag#Economy – Moving beyond oil, he built hashtag#Dubai into a hub for trade, tourism, aviation, and real estate — a reminder to never depend on one source of success.✈️ 4. Building Global Connectivity – Dubai’s airports and Emirates Airlines have made it a global transit hub. Connectivity breeds opportunity.🌍 5. Creating a Business-Friendly Environment – Tax-free zones and simplified regulations have made Dubai a magnet for global talent and investments.🏙️ 6. Balancing Tradition with Modernity – Despite its modern skyline, Dubai’s cultural roots remain intact — proof that growth and tradition can coexist.🚀 7. Bold Decision-Making – Projects like hashtag#Palm Jumeirah and Burj Khalifa were once unimaginable — but bold, strategic decisions turned them into reality.🌳 8. Sustainable Development – Sheikh Rashid ensured long-term planning and strategic reserves to future-proof Dubai’s success.🤝 9. Empowering the People – He invested in human capital, empowering people to contribute to Dubai’s success story.🏅 10. Leading with Humility and Service – Despite the immense success, Sheikh Rashid remained humble and connected with his people. True leadership is about serving others.💖 As I stood with my family, overwhelmed by the breathtaking views and the feeling of togetherness, I realized — with vision, courage, and purpose, you can transform the impossible into reality.Dubai is not just a city — it’s a testament to the power of visionary leadership. Have you visited Dubai?Share your experiences!hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Inspiration hashtag#Dubai hashtag#VisionaryLeadership hashtag#LessonsFromDubai hashtag#FamilyMoments HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum HH Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan hashtag#UAE Ishan Sharma

And that’s why Kristelle’s work matters.💙 And today, it’s extra special because it’s Kristelle’s birthday! 🎉 Happy birthday, sis! 🚨 Ripple forms partnership with UAE day after Binance’s AI deal in Gulf state.  In a significant development for the crypto space, Ripple has secured approval for regulated crypto payments and services in Dubai's International Financial Centre, further establishing the UAE as a global crypto hub  This move comes just a day after Binance announced a major  2 billion deal with an AI investment firm linked to the UAE government  Ripple's CEO emphasized the UAE's strategic position for accommodating the growing crypto industry The Dubai International Finance Centre operates under relaxed regulations and zero taxes on corporate and personal income, attracting entrepreneurs and investors from around the world  The collaboration between crypto giants like Ripple and Binance signifies a shift in focus towards the UAE, particularly as there are ongoing efforts in the US to attract digital asset firms However, the journey hasn't been entirely smooth for Ripple  The company faces legal challenges, including ongoing litigation with the Securities and Exchange Commission due to past securities law compliance issues  Nevertheless, recent developments hint at potential favorable outcomes as some SEC actions against Ripple have been dismissed in light of shifting regulatory attitudes under the new administration As the crypto market continues to evolve, investors should keep a close eye on these developments in the UAE, as well as the performance of XRP amidst market fluctuations  Following the recent rally led by Ripple, the crypto community remains hopeful for recovery, especially in the face of a dynamic legal landscape and market conditions that could impact asset values hashtag#memecoin hashtag#crypto hashtag#solana hashtag#Ethereum hashtag#ai hashtag#bitcoin hashtag#cryptocurrency⚠️ Disclaimer: This analysis is for informational purposes only and should not be considered financial or investment advice

The cost of living in SLO County is shifting. Child demographics are evolving. Unemployment rates tell a deeper story. But without real-time, hyper-local data, how do we ensure philanthropy is meeting the right needs?That’s why CAPSLO’s latest report on Head Start & Early Head Start is so important. It reveals key insights into the challenges and strengths of families in our region—information that directly impacts how nonprofits, donors, and policymakers can respond.At The Community Foundation San Luis Obispo County, we believe in data-driven philanthropy—because the best giving decisions start with facts, not assumptions. That’s why we created the CFSLOCO Data Center—a hub for trusted, local data to guide funding, strategy, and impact.With better insights, we can: * Align grants with emerging needs. * Strengthen nonprofit capacity with data-backed strategies. * Inspire donors to invest in areas of greatest impact.This new CAPSLO report is just one example of how access to the right data can shape a better future for San Luis Obispo County. Username: Financial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto RicoFinancial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto Rico
Post Content:
Hiring civil servants in Puerto Rico has long been a slow and complicated process, often taking months to fill vacancies. A new AI-driven hiring platform, launched through a hashtag#FOMBPR and Government of Puerto Rico-led hashtag#CivilServiceReform pilot program, cut hiring times to just 13 days, filling 339 positions in 7 months. In just seven months, 339 candidates were hired, surpassing expectations. “Civil service is not merely trying to change the compensation processes, but also the recruitment processes, learning processes, evaluation and development of employees, and organizational design. It is a comprehensive reform.” – Arnaldo Cruz, Deputy Executive Director of the FOMB. The program was so successful that it gained national recognition from the National Governors Association, making Puerto Rico a pioneer in AI-driven, skills-based hiring within the public sector. Read the full blog: https://bit.ly/3DF3e90

Dubai Real Estate: The First Crack in the Immaculate FacadeJanuary 2025: -0.57% drop in Dubai property prices. It’s a small figure, but symbolic — the first decline in 2.5 years of continuous growth.At the same time, developers seem to have ignored the signal: 53 new projects have been launched (+12,400 units).The battle of the titans continues: • Emaar (16.5% of the market) • Damac (15.8%) • Danube (5.3%).Market in numbers: 🔹 14,413 transactions — a record, but 4.6% lower than December 🔹 The secondary market is growing (+15.7%), while primary real estate is declining (-17.7%) 🔹 From ultra-luxury (villa for 425 million) to budget options (studio for 175k) 🔹 Mortgages: +6.8% in new loans despite regulatory restrictions“Dubai is transitioning from a phase of explosive growth to seeking balance,” says Property Monitor.What if January 2025 isn’t the end of the boom, but the start of an era of a sustainable market? A market where investors prefer real assets over castles in the air, and developers focus not on quantity, but on quality?As one analyst from Property Monitor aptly put it: “The era of guaranteed double-digit returns is fading, but opportunities remain — for those who know how to spot them.”

Inspired by  Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Vision During Our Dubai Visit Our recent family visit to Dubai left me truly amazed and hashtag#inspired. Standing at the top of hashtag#Burj Khalifa and dining at Atmosphere, I couldn’t help but reflect on how one man’s vision transformed a desert into one of the most sought-after destinations in the world.Sheikh Rashid bin Saeed Al Maktoum’s legacy is not just about the towering skyscrapers or the luxurious lifestyle — it’s about how he uplifted an entire community and positioned Dubai as a global icon.Here are 10 powerful leadership lessons that resonated deeply with me during this trip:✨ 1. Vision Beyond Limitations – Sheikh Rashid envisioned Dubai’s potential even when it was just a small fishing village. Greatness begins with a bold vision.🏆 2. Investing in Infrastructure – From Jebel Ali Port to the expansion of Dubai Creek, his focus on infrastructure laid the foundation for global success.💡 3. Diversification of hashtag#Economy – Moving beyond oil, he built hashtag#Dubai into a hub for trade, tourism, aviation, and real estate — a reminder to never depend on one source of success.✈️ 4. Building Global Connectivity – Dubai’s airports and Emirates Airlines have made it a global transit hub. Connectivity breeds opportunity.🌍 5. Creating a Business-Friendly Environment – Tax-free zones and simplified regulations have made Dubai a magnet for global talent and investments.🏙️ 6. Balancing Tradition with Modernity – Despite its modern skyline, Dubai’s cultural roots remain intact — proof that growth and tradition can coexist.🚀 7. Bold Decision-Making – Projects like hashtag#Palm Jumeirah and Burj Khalifa were once unimaginable — but bold, strategic decisions turned them into reality.🌳 8. Sustainable Development – Sheikh Rashid ensured long-term planning and strategic reserves to future-proof Dubai’s success.🤝 9. Empowering the People – He invested in human capital, empowering people to contribute to Dubai’s success story.🏅 10. Leading with Humility and Service – Despite the immense success, Sheikh Rashid remained humble and connected with his people. True leadership is about serving others.💖 As I stood with my family, overwhelmed by the breathtaking views and the feeling of togetherness, I realized — with vision, courage, and purpose, you can transform the impossible into reality.Dubai is not just a city — it’s a testament to the power of visionary leadership. Have you visited Dubai?Share your experiences!hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Inspiration hashtag#Dubai hashtag#VisionaryLeadership hashtag#LessonsFromDubai hashtag#FamilyMoments HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum HH Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan hashtag#UAE Ishan Sharma

🚨 Ripple forms partnership with UAE day after Binance’s AI deal in Gulf state.  In a significant development for the crypto space, Ripple has secured approval for regulated crypto payments and services in Dubai's International Financial Centre, further establishing the UAE as a global crypto hub  This move comes just a day after Binance announced a major  2 billion deal with an AI investment firm linked to the UAE government  Ripple's CEO emphasized the UAE's strategic position for accommodating the growing crypto industry The Dubai International Finance Centre operates under relaxed regulations and zero taxes on corporate and personal income, attracting entrepreneurs and investors from around the world  The collaboration between crypto giants like Ripple and Binance signifies a shift in focus towards the UAE, particularly as there are ongoing efforts in the US to attract digital asset firms However, the journey hasn't been entirely smooth for Ripple  The company faces legal challenges, including ongoing litigation with the Securities and Exchange Commission due to past securities law compliance issues  Nevertheless, recent developments hint at potential favorable outcomes as some SEC actions against Ripple have been dismissed in light of shifting regulatory attitudes under the new administration As the crypto market continues to evolve, investors should keep a close eye on these developments in the UAE, as well as the performance of XRP amidst market fluctuations  Following the recent rally led by Ripple, the crypto community remains hopeful for recovery, especially in the face of a dynamic legal landscape and market conditions that could impact asset values hashtag#memecoin hashtag#crypto hashtag#solana hashtag#Ethereum hashtag#ai hashtag#bitcoin hashtag#cryptocurrency⚠️ Disclaimer: This analysis is for informational purposes only and should not be considered financial or investment advice

Would you consider moving from Dubai to Qatar? The cost of living in SLO County is shifting. Child demographics are evolving. Unemployment rates tell a deeper story. But without real-time, hyper-local data, how do we ensure philanthropy is meeting the right needs?That’s why CAPSLO’s latest report on Head Start & Early Head Start is so important. It reveals key insights into the challenges and strengths of families in our region—information that directly impacts how nonprofits, donors, and policymakers can respond.At The Community Foundation San Luis Obispo County, we believe in data-driven philanthropy—because the best giving decisions start with facts, not assumptions. That’s why we created the CFSLOCO Data Center—a hub for trusted, local data to guide funding, strategy, and impact.With better insights, we can: * Align grants with emerging needs. * Strengthen nonprofit capacity with data-backed strategies. * Inspire donors to invest in areas of greatest impact.This new CAPSLO report is just one example of how access to the right data can shape a better future for San Luis Obispo County. Username: Financial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto RicoFinancial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto Rico
Post Content:
Hiring civil servants in Puerto Rico has long been a slow and complicated process, often taking months to fill vacancies. A new AI-driven hiring platform, launched through a hashtag#FOMBPR and Government of Puerto Rico-led hashtag#CivilServiceReform pilot program, cut hiring times to just 13 days, filling 339 positions in 7 months. In just seven months, 339 candidates were hired, surpassing expectations. “Civil service is not merely trying to change the compensation processes, but also the recruitment processes, learning processes, evaluation and development of employees, and organizational design. It is a comprehensive reform.” – Arnaldo Cruz, Deputy Executive Director of the FOMB. The program was so successful that it gained national recognition from the National Governors Association, making Puerto Rico a pioneer in AI-driven, skills-based hiring within the public sector. Read the full blog: https://bit.ly/3DF3e90

Dubai Real Estate: The First Crack in the Immaculate FacadeJanuary 2025: -0.57% drop in Dubai property prices. It’s a small figure, but symbolic — the first decline in 2.5 years of continuous growth.At the same time, developers seem to have ignored the signal: 53 new projects have been launched (+12,400 units).The battle of the titans continues: • Emaar (16.5% of the market) • Damac (15.8%) • Danube (5.3%).Market in numbers: 🔹 14,413 transactions — a record, but 4.6% lower than December 🔹 The secondary market is growing (+15.7%), while primary real estate is declining (-17.7%) 🔹 From ultra-luxury (villa for 425 million) to budget options (studio for 175k) 🔹 Mortgages: +6.8% in new loans despite regulatory restrictions“Dubai is transitioning from a phase of explosive growth to seeking balance,” says Property Monitor.What if January 2025 isn’t the end of the boom, but the start of an era of a sustainable market? A market where investors prefer real assets over castles in the air, and developers focus not on quantity, but on quality?As one analyst from Property Monitor aptly put it: “The era of guaranteed double-digit returns is fading, but opportunities remain — for those who know how to spot them.”

Inspired by  Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Vision During Our Dubai Visit Our recent family visit to Dubai left me truly amazed and hashtag#inspired. Standing at the top of hashtag#Burj Khalifa and dining at Atmosphere, I couldn’t help but reflect on how one man’s vision transformed a desert into one of the most sought-after destinations in the world.Sheikh Rashid bin Saeed Al Maktoum’s legacy is not just about the towering skyscrapers or the luxurious lifestyle — it’s about how he uplifted an entire community and positioned Dubai as a global icon.Here are 10 powerful leadership lessons that resonated deeply with me during this trip:✨ 1. Vision Beyond Limitations – Sheikh Rashid envisioned Dubai’s potential even when it was just a small fishing village. Greatness begins with a bold vision.🏆 2. Investing in Infrastructure – From Jebel Ali Port to the expansion of Dubai Creek, his focus on infrastructure laid the foundation for global success.💡 3. Diversification of hashtag#Economy – Moving beyond oil, he built hashtag#Dubai into a hub for trade, tourism, aviation, and real estate — a reminder to never depend on one source of success.✈️ 4. Building Global Connectivity – Dubai’s airports and Emirates Airlines have made it a global transit hub. Connectivity breeds opportunity.🌍 5. Creating a Business-Friendly Environment – Tax-free zones and simplified regulations have made Dubai a magnet for global talent and investments.🏙️ 6. Balancing Tradition with Modernity – Despite its modern skyline, Dubai’s cultural roots remain intact — proof that growth and tradition can coexist.🚀 7. Bold Decision-Making – Projects like hashtag#Palm Jumeirah and Burj Khalifa were once unimaginable — but bold, strategic decisions turned them into reality.🌳 8. Sustainable Development – Sheikh Rashid ensured long-term planning and strategic reserves to future-proof Dubai’s success.🤝 9. Empowering the People – He invested in human capital, empowering people to contribute to Dubai’s success story.🏅 10. Leading with Humility and Service – Despite the immense success, Sheikh Rashid remained humble and connected with his people. True leadership is about serving others.💖 As I stood with my family, overwhelmed by the breathtaking views and the feeling of togetherness, I realized — with vision, courage, and purpose, you can transform the impossible into reality.Dubai is not just a city — it’s a testament to the power of visionary leadership. Have you visited Dubai?Share your experiences!hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Inspiration hashtag#Dubai hashtag#VisionaryLeadership hashtag#LessonsFromDubai hashtag#FamilyMoments HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum HH Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan hashtag#UAE Ishan Sharma

Best Time to Visit UAE for a Job Search!If you’re planning to come to the UAE on a visit visa to find a job, timing is everything! Here’s when you have the highest chances of landing a job:✅ January – April (Peak Hiring Season)Companies have fresh hiring budgets, and recruitment is in full swing! This is one of the best times to apply and attend interviews.✅ September – November (Post-Summer Hiring Surge)After the summer break, businesses resume hiring, and there’s a strong demand for new talent( I personally suggest at post summer periods)🚫 Months to Avoid❌ May – August – The UAE summer slows down recruitment as many decision-makers go on vacation and also it’s Ramadan time!! ❌ December – The holiday season means fewer job openings except for urgent roles.💡 Pro Tip: Start applying before you arrive, network actively , Do courses for relevant work needs and focus on high-demand industries like real estate, tech and marketing…..If you found this helpful, share it with someone who’s planning to job hunt in the UAE 🇦🇪 Always WELCOME 💜hashtag#ganustories

🚨 Ripple forms partnership with UAE day after Binance’s AI deal in Gulf state.  In a significant development for the crypto space, Ripple has secured approval for regulated crypto payments and services in Dubai's International Financial Centre, further establishing the UAE as a global crypto hub  This move comes just a day after Binance announced a major  2 billion deal with an AI investment firm linked to the UAE government  Ripple's CEO emphasized the UAE's strategic position for accommodating the growing crypto industry The Dubai International Finance Centre operates under relaxed regulations and zero taxes on corporate and personal income, attracting entrepreneurs and investors from around the world  The collaboration between crypto giants like Ripple and Binance signifies a shift in focus towards the UAE, particularly as there are ongoing efforts in the US to attract digital asset firms However, the journey hasn't been entirely smooth for Ripple  The company faces legal challenges, including ongoing litigation with the Securities and Exchange Commission due to past securities law compliance issues  Nevertheless, recent developments hint at potential favorable outcomes as some SEC actions against Ripple have been dismissed in light of shifting regulatory attitudes under the new administration As the crypto market continues to evolve, investors should keep a close eye on these developments in the UAE, as well as the performance of XRP amidst market fluctuations  Following the recent rally led by Ripple, the crypto community remains hopeful for recovery, especially in the face of a dynamic legal landscape and market conditions that could impact asset values hashtag#memecoin hashtag#crypto hashtag#solana hashtag#Ethereum hashtag#ai hashtag#bitcoin hashtag#cryptocurrency⚠️ Disclaimer: This analysis is for informational purposes only and should not be considered financial or investment advice

Why Are Professionals & Businesses Moving from Dubai to Qatar?The Gulf job market is always evolving, and lately, a noticeable shift is happening—many are relocating from Dubai to Qatar for new opportunities. But why? Here’s what’s driving the move:✅ Booming Economy – Qatar’s diversification efforts, investments, and FIFA 2022 legacy have supercharged its growth.✅ Business-Friendly Policies – 100% foreign ownership in many sectors and incentives for entrepreneurs.✅ Competitive Salaries & Benefits – Many professionals find lucrative packages with lower living costs.✅ Massive Infrastructure & Development – From Lusail City to Hamad Port, Qatar is building the future.✅ Work-Life Balance – A less hectic lifestyle compared to Dubai’s fast-paced hustle.For many, Qatar is the next big destination for career growth and business expansion. 🌍💼💬 What do you think? Would you consider moving from Dubai to Qatar? The cost of living in SLO County is shifting. Child demographics are evolving. Unemployment rates tell a deeper story. But without real-time, hyper-local data, how do we ensure philanthropy is meeting the right needs?That’s why CAPSLO’s latest report on Head Start & Early Head Start is so important. It reveals key insights into the challenges and strengths of families in our region—information that directly impacts how nonprofits, donors, and policymakers can respond.At The Community Foundation San Luis Obispo County, we believe in data-driven philanthropy—because the best giving decisions start with facts, not assumptions. That’s why we created the CFSLOCO Data Center—a hub for trusted, local data to guide funding, strategy, and impact.With better insights, we can: * Align grants with emerging needs. * Strengthen nonprofit capacity with data-backed strategies. * Inspire donors to invest in areas of greatest impact.This new CAPSLO report is just one example of how access to the right data can shape a better future for San Luis Obispo County. Username: Financial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto RicoFinancial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto Rico
Post Content:
Hiring civil servants in Puerto Rico has long been a slow and complicated process, often taking months to fill vacancies. A new AI-driven hiring platform, launched through a hashtag#FOMBPR and Government of Puerto Rico-led hashtag#CivilServiceReform pilot program, cut hiring times to just 13 days, filling 339 positions in 7 months. In just seven months, 339 candidates were hired, surpassing expectations. “Civil service is not merely trying to change the compensation processes, but also the recruitment processes, learning processes, evaluation and development of employees, and organizational design. It is a comprehensive reform.” – Arnaldo Cruz, Deputy Executive Director of the FOMB. The program was so successful that it gained national recognition from the National Governors Association, making Puerto Rico a pioneer in AI-driven, skills-based hiring within the public sector. Read the full blog: https://bit.ly/3DF3e90

Dubai Real Estate: The First Crack in the Immaculate FacadeJanuary 2025: -0.57% drop in Dubai property prices. It’s a small figure, but symbolic — the first decline in 2.5 years of continuous growth.At the same time, developers seem to have ignored the signal: 53 new projects have been launched (+12,400 units).The battle of the titans continues: • Emaar (16.5% of the market) • Damac (15.8%) • Danube (5.3%).Market in numbers: 🔹 14,413 transactions — a record, but 4.6% lower than December 🔹 The secondary market is growing (+15.7%), while primary real estate is declining (-17.7%) 🔹 From ultra-luxury (villa for 425 million) to budget options (studio for 175k) 🔹 Mortgages: +6.8% in new loans despite regulatory restrictions“Dubai is transitioning from a phase of explosive growth to seeking balance,” says Property Monitor.What if January 2025 isn’t the end of the boom, but the start of an era of a sustainable market? A market where investors prefer real assets over castles in the air, and developers focus not on quantity, but on quality?As one analyst from Property Monitor aptly put it: “The era of guaranteed double-digit returns is fading, but opportunities remain — for those who know how to spot them.”

Inspired by  Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Vision During Our Dubai Visit Our recent family visit to Dubai left me truly amazed and hashtag#inspired. Standing at the top of hashtag#Burj Khalifa and dining at Atmosphere, I couldn’t help but reflect on how one man’s vision transformed a desert into one of the most sought-after destinations in the world.Sheikh Rashid bin Saeed Al Maktoum’s legacy is not just about the towering skyscrapers or the luxurious lifestyle — it’s about how he uplifted an entire community and positioned Dubai as a global icon.Here are 10 powerful leadership lessons that resonated deeply with me during this trip:✨ 1. Vision Beyond Limitations – Sheikh Rashid envisioned Dubai’s potential even when it was just a small fishing village. Greatness begins with a bold vision.🏆 2. Investing in Infrastructure – From Jebel Ali Port to the expansion of Dubai Creek, his focus on infrastructure laid the foundation for global success.💡 3. Diversification of hashtag#Economy – Moving beyond oil, he built hashtag#Dubai into a hub for trade, tourism, aviation, and real estate — a reminder to never depend on one source of success.✈️ 4. Building Global Connectivity – Dubai’s airports and Emirates Airlines have made it a global transit hub. Connectivity breeds opportunity.🌍 5. Creating a Business-Friendly Environment – Tax-free zones and simplified regulations have made Dubai a magnet for global talent and investments.🏙️ 6. Balancing Tradition with Modernity – Despite its modern skyline, Dubai’s cultural roots remain intact — proof that growth and tradition can coexist.🚀 7. Bold Decision-Making – Projects like hashtag#Palm Jumeirah and Burj Khalifa were once unimaginable — but bold, strategic decisions turned them into reality.🌳 8. Sustainable Development – Sheikh Rashid ensured long-term planning and strategic reserves to future-proof Dubai’s success.🤝 9. Empowering the People – He invested in human capital, empowering people to contribute to Dubai’s success story.🏅 10. Leading with Humility and Service – Despite the immense success, Sheikh Rashid remained humble and connected with his people. True leadership is about serving others.💖 As I stood with my family, overwhelmed by the breathtaking views and the feeling of togetherness, I realized — with vision, courage, and purpose, you can transform the impossible into reality.Dubai is not just a city — it’s a testament to the power of visionary leadership. Have you visited Dubai?Share your experiences!hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Inspiration hashtag#Dubai hashtag#VisionaryLeadership hashtag#LessonsFromDubai hashtag#FamilyMoments HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum HH Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan hashtag#UAE Ishan Sharma

Best Time to Visit UAE for a Job Search!If you’re planning to come to the UAE on a visit visa to find a job, timing is everything! Here’s when you have the highest chances of landing a job:✅ January – April (Peak Hiring Season)Companies have fresh hiring budgets, and recruitment is in full swing! This is one of the best times to apply and attend interviews.✅ September – November (Post-Summer Hiring Surge)After the summer break, businesses resume hiring, and there’s a strong demand for new talent( I personally suggest at post summer periods)🚫 Months to Avoid❌ May – August – The UAE summer slows down recruitment as many decision-makers go on vacation and also it’s Ramadan time!! ❌ December – The holiday season means fewer job openings except for urgent roles.💡 Pro Tip: Start applying before you arrive, network actively , Do courses for relevant work needs and focus on high-demand industries like real estate, tech and marketing…..If you found this helpful, share it with someone who’s planning to job hunt in the UAE 🇦🇪 Always WELCOME 💜hashtag#ganustories

🚨 Ripple forms partnership with UAE day after Binance’s AI deal in Gulf state.  In a significant development for the crypto space, Ripple has secured approval for regulated crypto payments and services in Dubai's International Financial Centre, further establishing the UAE as a global crypto hub  This move comes just a day after Binance announced a major  2 billion deal with an AI investment firm linked to the UAE government  Ripple's CEO emphasized the UAE's strategic position for accommodating the growing crypto industry The Dubai International Finance Centre operates under relaxed regulations and zero taxes on corporate and personal income, attracting entrepreneurs and investors from around the world  The collaboration between crypto giants like Ripple and Binance signifies a shift in focus towards the UAE, particularly as there are ongoing efforts in the US to attract digital asset firms However, the journey hasn't been entirely smooth for Ripple  The company faces legal challenges, including ongoing litigation with the Securities and Exchange Commission due to past securities law compliance issues  Nevertheless, recent developments hint at potential favorable outcomes as some SEC actions against Ripple have been dismissed in light of shifting regulatory attitudes under the new administration As the crypto market continues to evolve, investors should keep a close eye on these developments in the UAE, as well as the performance of XRP amidst market fluctuations  Following the recent rally led by Ripple, the crypto community remains hopeful for recovery, especially in the face of a dynamic legal landscape and market conditions that could impact asset values hashtag#memecoin hashtag#crypto hashtag#solana hashtag#Ethereum hashtag#ai hashtag#bitcoin hashtag#cryptocurrency⚠️ Disclaimer: This analysis is for informational purposes only and should not be considered financial or investment advice

Why Are Professionals & Businesses Moving from Dubai to Qatar?The Gulf job market is always evolving, and lately, a noticeable shift is happening—many are relocating from Dubai to Qatar for new opportunities. But why? Here’s what’s driving the move:✅ Booming Economy – Qatar’s diversification efforts, investments, and FIFA 2022 legacy have supercharged its growth.✅ Business-Friendly Policies – 100% foreign ownership in many sectors and incentives for entrepreneurs.✅ Competitive Salaries & Benefits – Many professionals find lucrative packages with lower living costs.✅ Massive Infrastructure & Development – From Lusail City to Hamad Port, Qatar is building the future.✅ Work-Life Balance – A less hectic lifestyle compared to Dubai’s fast-paced hustle.For many, Qatar is the next big destination for career growth and business expansion. 🌍💼💬 What do you think? Would you consider moving from Dubai to Qatar? The cost of living in SLO County is shifting. Child demographics are evolving. Unemployment rates tell a deeper story. But without real-time, hyper-local data, how do we ensure philanthropy is meeting the right needs?That’s why CAPSLO’s latest report on Head Start & Early Head Start is so important. It reveals key insights into the challenges and strengths of families in our region—information that directly impacts how nonprofits, donors, and policymakers can respond.At The Community Foundation San Luis Obispo County, we believe in data-driven philanthropy—because the best giving decisions start with facts, not assumptions. That’s why we created the CFSLOCO Data Center—a hub for trusted, local data to guide funding, strategy, and impact.With better insights, we can: * Align grants with emerging needs. * Strengthen nonprofit capacity with data-backed strategies. * Inspire donors to invest in areas of greatest impact.This new CAPSLO report is just one example of how access to the right data can shape a better future for San Luis Obispo County. Username: Financial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto RicoFinancial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto Rico
Post Content:
Hiring civil servants in Puerto Rico has long been a slow and complicated process, often taking months to fill vacancies. A new AI-driven hiring platform, launched through a hashtag#FOMBPR and Government of Puerto Rico-led hashtag#CivilServiceReform pilot program, cut hiring times to just 13 days, filling 339 positions in 7 months. In just seven months, 339 candidates were hired, surpassing expectations. “Civil service is not merely trying to change the compensation processes, but also the recruitment processes, learning processes, evaluation and development of employees, and organizational design. It is a comprehensive reform.” – Arnaldo Cruz, Deputy Executive Director of the FOMB. The program was so successful that it gained national recognition from the National Governors Association, making Puerto Rico a pioneer in AI-driven, skills-based hiring within the public sector. Read the full blog: https://bit.ly/3DF3e90

A market where investors prefer real assets over castles in the air, and developers focus not on quantity, but on quality?As one analyst from Property Monitor aptly put it: “The era of guaranteed double-digit returns is fading, but opportunities remain — for those who know how to spot them.”

Inspired by  Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Vision During Our Dubai Visit Our recent family visit to Dubai left me truly amazed and hashtag#inspired. Standing at the top of hashtag#Burj Khalifa and dining at Atmosphere, I couldn’t help but reflect on how one man’s vision transformed a desert into one of the most sought-after destinations in the world.Sheikh Rashid bin Saeed Al Maktoum’s legacy is not just about the towering skyscrapers or the luxurious lifestyle — it’s about how he uplifted an entire community and positioned Dubai as a global icon.Here are 10 powerful leadership lessons that resonated deeply with me during this trip:✨ 1. Vision Beyond Limitations – Sheikh Rashid envisioned Dubai’s potential even when it was just a small fishing village. Greatness begins with a bold vision.🏆 2. Investing in Infrastructure – From Jebel Ali Port to the expansion of Dubai Creek, his focus on infrastructure laid the foundation for global success.💡 3. Diversification of hashtag#Economy – Moving beyond oil, he built hashtag#Dubai into a hub for trade, tourism, aviation, and real estate — a reminder to never depend on one source of success.✈️ 4. Building Global Connectivity – Dubai’s airports and Emirates Airlines have made it a global transit hub. Connectivity breeds opportunity.🌍 5. Creating a Business-Friendly Environment – Tax-free zones and simplified regulations have made Dubai a magnet for global talent and investments.🏙️ 6. Balancing Tradition with Modernity – Despite its modern skyline, Dubai’s cultural roots remain intact — proof that growth and tradition can coexist.🚀 7. Bold Decision-Making – Projects like hashtag#Palm Jumeirah and Burj Khalifa were once unimaginable — but bold, strategic decisions turned them into reality.🌳 8. Sustainable Development – Sheikh Rashid ensured long-term planning and strategic reserves to future-proof Dubai’s success.🤝 9. Empowering the People – He invested in human capital, empowering people to contribute to Dubai’s success story.🏅 10. Leading with Humility and Service – Despite the immense success, Sheikh Rashid remained humble and connected with his people. True leadership is about serving others.💖 As I stood with my family, overwhelmed by the breathtaking views and the feeling of togetherness, I realized — with vision, courage, and purpose, you can transform the impossible into reality.Dubai is not just a city — it’s a testament to the power of visionary leadership. Have you visited Dubai?Share your experiences!hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Inspiration hashtag#Dubai hashtag#VisionaryLeadership hashtag#LessonsFromDubai hashtag#FamilyMoments HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum HH Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan hashtag#UAE Ishan Sharma

Best Time to Visit UAE for a Job Search!If you’re planning to come to the UAE on a visit visa to find a job, timing is everything! Here’s when you have the highest chances of landing a job:✅ January – April (Peak Hiring Season)Companies have fresh hiring budgets, and recruitment is in full swing! This is one of the best times to apply and attend interviews.✅ September – November (Post-Summer Hiring Surge)After the summer break, businesses resume hiring, and there’s a strong demand for new talent( I personally suggest at post summer periods)🚫 Months to Avoid❌ May – August – The UAE summer slows down recruitment as many decision-makers go on vacation and also it’s Ramadan time!! ❌ December – The holiday season means fewer job openings except for urgent roles.💡 Pro Tip: Start applying before you arrive, network actively , Do courses for relevant work needs and focus on high-demand industries like real estate, tech and marketing…..If you found this helpful, share it with someone who’s planning to job hunt in the UAE 🇦🇪 Always WELCOME 💜hashtag#ganustories

So here we are ... a whole eight weeks in to my time with Kevin McCallum and Polaris Software… and what a ride it’s been.In that time and since the inception of a Group People Team we have...✅ Rolled out group life assurance, rolled out a health care cash plan, rolled out a Cycle to Work scheme, launched income protection✅ Launched a new much more user friendly HRIS & ATS✅ Introduced a People team to the Group who work in sprints ✅ Moved our pension to salary sacrifice✅ Hired 7 incredible new people—from first posting an ad to joining us! For context we've also had over 1,500 applicants since the end of January✅ Aligned holiday entitlements across the Group✅ Supported two colleague-voted charities with important work they do✅ Rolled out Moment in Time days because hey, life milestones are not to be missed✅ Spent HOURS on trains to London, Preston, Sheffield & Banbury (turns out I am quite productive on a train. Thank you Seatfrog 🐸 )✅ Organised a glorious all-company event at The Gherkin✅ Run our first proper eNPS survey and saw a huge uptick in the score. The qualitative data made my heart sing! ✅ Increased group comms with regular Town Halls✅ Seen almost a double in our LinkedIn following✅ Had more human and real conversations than we can shake a stick at! Yes yes there is a strategist in me.. and I know that is loads of clean up - but levelling the bar first is key. The strategy stuff will come & we’re not slowing down… right now, we’re deep in to planning:🔄 OKRs & goal setting📚 Manager training📝 A brand-new employee handbook🌍 Building an intranet⚠️ Health and Safety Compliance🔨 Designs for office face-lifts🌟 Accreditation applicationsThe list keeps growing, but hey—it’s good to be busy, right?Am I tired? Absolutely.Exhausted? 100%.Still feeling sparky? You bet. That's the thing about working in a People team isn't it? There is so much BAU we can't shout about and this is 'just' a list... there are so many more things that Elle Thomas deserves a shout out for that will have to be held for our 1:1s 🌟

🌟 Dubai: Where Dreams Take Shape 🌟“Dubai is built on dreams - big ones, tall ones, fast ones, and everything in between. This truly is the city that never sleeps, never slows, never says ‘it can’t be done.’ In Dubai, if you can dream it, you can create it.” – Mimi Nicklin - Empathy AdvocateDubai is more than just a city; it’s a launchpad for visionaries. People arrive here not just seeking opportunity, but creating it - entrepreneurs, designers, teachers, and, of course, home-seekers looking for their next chapter.This is where my sister, Kristelle Cronjé, steps in. And that’s why Kristelle’s work matters.💙 And today, it’s extra special because it’s Kristelle’s birthday! 🎉 Happy birthday, sis! 🚨 Ripple forms partnership with UAE day after Binance’s AI deal in Gulf state.  In a significant development for the crypto space, Ripple has secured approval for regulated crypto payments and services in Dubai's International Financial Centre, further establishing the UAE as a global crypto hub  This move comes just a day after Binance announced a major  2 billion deal with an AI investment firm linked to the UAE government  Ripple's CEO emphasized the UAE's strategic position for accommodating the growing crypto industry The Dubai International Finance Centre operates under relaxed regulations and zero taxes on corporate and personal income, attracting entrepreneurs and investors from around the world  The collaboration between crypto giants like Ripple and Binance signifies a shift in focus towards the UAE, particularly as there are ongoing efforts in the US to attract digital asset firms However, the journey hasn't been entirely smooth for Ripple  The company faces legal challenges, including ongoing litigation with the Securities and Exchange Commission due to past securities law compliance issues  Nevertheless, recent developments hint at potential favorable outcomes as some SEC actions against Ripple have been dismissed in light of shifting regulatory attitudes under the new administration As the crypto market continues to evolve, investors should keep a close eye on these developments in the UAE, as well as the performance of XRP amidst market fluctuations  Following the recent rally led by Ripple, the crypto community remains hopeful for recovery, especially in the face of a dynamic legal landscape and market conditions that could impact asset values hashtag#memecoin hashtag#crypto hashtag#solana hashtag#Ethereum hashtag#ai hashtag#bitcoin hashtag#cryptocurrency⚠️ Disclaimer: This analysis is for informational purposes only and should not be considered financial or investment advice

Here’s what’s driving the move:✅ Booming Economy – Qatar’s diversification efforts, investments, and FIFA 2022 legacy have supercharged its growth.✅ Business-Friendly Policies – 100% foreign ownership in many sectors and incentives for entrepreneurs.✅ Competitive Salaries & Benefits – Many professionals find lucrative packages with lower living costs.✅ Massive Infrastructure & Development – From Lusail City to Hamad Port, Qatar is building the future.✅ Work-Life Balance – A less hectic lifestyle compared to Dubai’s fast-paced hustle.For many, Qatar is the next big destination for career growth and business expansion. 🌍💼💬 What do you think? The cost of living in SLO County is shifting. Child demographics are evolving. Unemployment rates tell a deeper story. But without real-time, hyper-local data, how do we ensure philanthropy is meeting the right needs?That’s why CAPSLO’s latest report on Head Start & Early Head Start is so important. It reveals key insights into the challenges and strengths of families in our region—information that directly impacts how nonprofits, donors, and policymakers can respond.At The Community Foundation San Luis Obispo County, we believe in data-driven philanthropy—because the best giving decisions start with facts, not assumptions. That’s why we created the CFSLOCO Data Center—a hub for trusted, local data to guide funding, strategy, and impact.With better insights, we can: * Align grants with emerging needs. * Strengthen nonprofit capacity with data-backed strategies. * Inspire donors to invest in areas of greatest impact.This new CAPSLO report is just one example of how access to the right data can shape a better future for San Luis Obispo County. Username: Financial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto RicoFinancial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto Rico
Post Content:
Hiring civil servants in Puerto Rico has long been a slow and complicated process, often taking months to fill vacancies. A new AI-driven hiring platform, launched through a hashtag#FOMBPR and Government of Puerto Rico-led hashtag#CivilServiceReform pilot program, cut hiring times to just 13 days, filling 339 positions in 7 months. In just seven months, 339 candidates were hired, surpassing expectations. “Civil service is not merely trying to change the compensation processes, but also the recruitment processes, learning processes, evaluation and development of employees, and organizational design. It is a comprehensive reform.” – Arnaldo Cruz, Deputy Executive Director of the FOMB. The program was so successful that it gained national recognition from the National Governors Association, making Puerto Rico a pioneer in AI-driven, skills-based hiring within the public sector. Read the full blog: https://bit.ly/3DF3e90

It’s a small figure, but symbolic — the first decline in 2.5 years of continuous growth.At the same time, developers seem to have ignored the signal: 53 new projects have been launched (+12,400 units).The battle of the titans continues: • Emaar (16.5% of the market) • Damac (15.8%) • Danube (5.3%).Market in numbers: 🔹 14,413 transactions — a record, but 4.6% lower than December 🔹 The secondary market is growing (+15.7%), while primary real estate is declining (-17.7%) 🔹 From ultra-luxury (villa for 425 million) to budget options (studio for 175k) 🔹 Mortgages: +6.8% in new loans despite regulatory restrictions“Dubai is transitioning from a phase of explosive growth to seeking balance,” says Property Monitor.What if January 2025 isn’t the end of the boom, but the start of an era of a sustainable market? A market where investors prefer real assets over castles in the air, and developers focus not on quantity, but on quality?As one analyst from Property Monitor aptly put it: “The era of guaranteed double-digit returns is fading, but opportunities remain — for those who know how to spot them.”

Inspired by  Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Vision During Our Dubai Visit Our recent family visit to Dubai left me truly amazed and hashtag#inspired. Standing at the top of hashtag#Burj Khalifa and dining at Atmosphere, I couldn’t help but reflect on how one man’s vision transformed a desert into one of the most sought-after destinations in the world.Sheikh Rashid bin Saeed Al Maktoum’s legacy is not just about the towering skyscrapers or the luxurious lifestyle — it’s about how he uplifted an entire community and positioned Dubai as a global icon.Here are 10 powerful leadership lessons that resonated deeply with me during this trip:✨ 1. Vision Beyond Limitations – Sheikh Rashid envisioned Dubai’s potential even when it was just a small fishing village. Greatness begins with a bold vision.🏆 2. Investing in Infrastructure – From Jebel Ali Port to the expansion of Dubai Creek, his focus on infrastructure laid the foundation for global success.💡 3. Diversification of hashtag#Economy – Moving beyond oil, he built hashtag#Dubai into a hub for trade, tourism, aviation, and real estate — a reminder to never depend on one source of success.✈️ 4. Building Global Connectivity – Dubai’s airports and Emirates Airlines have made it a global transit hub. Connectivity breeds opportunity.🌍 5. Creating a Business-Friendly Environment – Tax-free zones and simplified regulations have made Dubai a magnet for global talent and investments.🏙️ 6. Balancing Tradition with Modernity – Despite its modern skyline, Dubai’s cultural roots remain intact — proof that growth and tradition can coexist.🚀 7. Bold Decision-Making – Projects like hashtag#Palm Jumeirah and Burj Khalifa were once unimaginable — but bold, strategic decisions turned them into reality.🌳 8. Sustainable Development – Sheikh Rashid ensured long-term planning and strategic reserves to future-proof Dubai’s success.🤝 9. Empowering the People – He invested in human capital, empowering people to contribute to Dubai’s success story.🏅 10. Leading with Humility and Service – Despite the immense success, Sheikh Rashid remained humble and connected with his people. True leadership is about serving others.💖 As I stood with my family, overwhelmed by the breathtaking views and the feeling of togetherness, I realized — with vision, courage, and purpose, you can transform the impossible into reality.Dubai is not just a city — it’s a testament to the power of visionary leadership. Have you visited Dubai?Share your experiences!hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Inspiration hashtag#Dubai hashtag#VisionaryLeadership hashtag#LessonsFromDubai hashtag#FamilyMoments HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum HH Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan hashtag#UAE Ishan Sharma

Best Time to Visit UAE for a Job Search!If you’re planning to come to the UAE on a visit visa to find a job, timing is everything! Here’s when you have the highest chances of landing a job:✅ January – April (Peak Hiring Season)Companies have fresh hiring budgets, and recruitment is in full swing! This is one of the best times to apply and attend interviews.✅ September – November (Post-Summer Hiring Surge)After the summer break, businesses resume hiring, and there’s a strong demand for new talent( I personally suggest at post summer periods)🚫 Months to Avoid❌ May – August – The UAE summer slows down recruitment as many decision-makers go on vacation and also it’s Ramadan time!! ❌ December – The holiday season means fewer job openings except for urgent roles.💡 Pro Tip: Start applying before you arrive, network actively , Do courses for relevant work needs and focus on high-demand industries like real estate, tech and marketing…..If you found this helpful, share it with someone who’s planning to job hunt in the UAE 🇦🇪 Always WELCOME 💜hashtag#ganustories

So here we are ... a whole eight weeks in to my time with Kevin McCallum and Polaris Software… and what a ride it’s been.In that time and since the inception of a Group People Team we have...✅ Rolled out group life assurance, rolled out a health care cash plan, rolled out a Cycle to Work scheme, launched income protection✅ Launched a new much more user friendly HRIS & ATS✅ Introduced a People team to the Group who work in sprints ✅ Moved our pension to salary sacrifice✅ Hired 7 incredible new people—from first posting an ad to joining us! For context we've also had over 1,500 applicants since the end of January✅ Aligned holiday entitlements across the Group✅ Supported two colleague-voted charities with important work they do✅ Rolled out Moment in Time days because hey, life milestones are not to be missed✅ Spent HOURS on trains to London, Preston, Sheffield & Banbury (turns out I am quite productive on a train. Thank you Seatfrog 🐸 )✅ Organised a glorious all-company event at The Gherkin✅ Run our first proper eNPS survey and saw a huge uptick in the score. The qualitative data made my heart sing! ✅ Increased group comms with regular Town Halls✅ Seen almost a double in our LinkedIn following✅ Had more human and real conversations than we can shake a stick at! Yes yes there is a strategist in me.. and I know that is loads of clean up - but levelling the bar first is key. The strategy stuff will come & we’re not slowing down… right now, we’re deep in to planning:🔄 OKRs & goal setting📚 Manager training📝 A brand-new employee handbook🌍 Building an intranet⚠️ Health and Safety Compliance🔨 Designs for office face-lifts🌟 Accreditation applicationsThe list keeps growing, but hey—it’s good to be busy, right?Am I tired? Absolutely.Exhausted? 100%.Still feeling sparky? You bet. That's the thing about working in a People team isn't it? There is so much BAU we can't shout about and this is 'just' a list... there are so many more things that Elle Thomas deserves a shout out for that will have to be held for our 1:1s 🌟

And that’s why Kristelle’s work matters.💙 And today, it’s extra special because it’s Kristelle’s birthday! 🎉 Happy birthday, sis! 🚨 Ripple forms partnership with UAE day after Binance’s AI deal in Gulf state.  In a significant development for the crypto space, Ripple has secured approval for regulated crypto payments and services in Dubai's International Financial Centre, further establishing the UAE as a global crypto hub  This move comes just a day after Binance announced a major  2 billion deal with an AI investment firm linked to the UAE government  Ripple's CEO emphasized the UAE's strategic position for accommodating the growing crypto industry The Dubai International Finance Centre operates under relaxed regulations and zero taxes on corporate and personal income, attracting entrepreneurs and investors from around the world  The collaboration between crypto giants like Ripple and Binance signifies a shift in focus towards the UAE, particularly as there are ongoing efforts in the US to attract digital asset firms However, the journey hasn't been entirely smooth for Ripple  The company faces legal challenges, including ongoing litigation with the Securities and Exchange Commission due to past securities law compliance issues  Nevertheless, recent developments hint at potential favorable outcomes as some SEC actions against Ripple have been dismissed in light of shifting regulatory attitudes under the new administration As the crypto market continues to evolve, investors should keep a close eye on these developments in the UAE, as well as the performance of XRP amidst market fluctuations  Following the recent rally led by Ripple, the crypto community remains hopeful for recovery, especially in the face of a dynamic legal landscape and market conditions that could impact asset values hashtag#memecoin hashtag#crypto hashtag#solana hashtag#Ethereum hashtag#ai hashtag#bitcoin hashtag#cryptocurrency⚠️ Disclaimer: This analysis is for informational purposes only and should not be considered financial or investment advice

The cost of living in SLO County is shifting. Child demographics are evolving. Unemployment rates tell a deeper story. But without real-time, hyper-local data, how do we ensure philanthropy is meeting the right needs?That’s why CAPSLO’s latest report on Head Start & Early Head Start is so important. It reveals key insights into the challenges and strengths of families in our region—information that directly impacts how nonprofits, donors, and policymakers can respond.At The Community Foundation San Luis Obispo County, we believe in data-driven philanthropy—because the best giving decisions start with facts, not assumptions. That’s why we created the CFSLOCO Data Center—a hub for trusted, local data to guide funding, strategy, and impact.With better insights, we can: * Align grants with emerging needs. * Strengthen nonprofit capacity with data-backed strategies. * Inspire donors to invest in areas of greatest impact.This new CAPSLO report is just one example of how access to the right data can shape a better future for San Luis Obispo County. Username: Financial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto RicoFinancial Oversight & Management Board for Puerto Rico
Post Content:
Hiring civil servants in Puerto Rico has long been a slow and complicated process, often taking months to fill vacancies. A new AI-driven hiring platform, launched through a hashtag#FOMBPR and Government of Puerto Rico-led hashtag#CivilServiceReform pilot program, cut hiring times to just 13 days, filling 339 positions in 7 months. In just seven months, 339 candidates were hired, surpassing expectations. “Civil service is not merely trying to change the compensation processes, but also the recruitment processes, learning processes, evaluation and development of employees, and organizational design. It is a comprehensive reform.” – Arnaldo Cruz, Deputy Executive Director of the FOMB. The program was so successful that it gained national recognition from the National Governors Association, making Puerto Rico a pioneer in AI-driven, skills-based hiring within the public sector. Read the full blog: https://bit.ly/3DF3e90

Dubai Real Estate: The First Crack in the Immaculate FacadeJanuary 2025: -0.57% drop in Dubai property prices. It’s a small figure, but symbolic — the first decline in 2.5 years of continuous growth.At the same time, developers seem to have ignored the signal: 53 new projects have been launched (+12,400 units).The battle of the titans continues: • Emaar (16.5% of the market) • Damac (15.8%) • Danube (5.3%).Market in numbers: 🔹 14,413 transactions — a record, but 4.6% lower than December 🔹 The secondary market is growing (+15.7%), while primary real estate is declining (-17.7%) 🔹 From ultra-luxury (villa for 425 million) to budget options (studio for 175k) 🔹 Mortgages: +6.8% in new loans despite regulatory restrictions“Dubai is transitioning from a phase of explosive growth to seeking balance,” says Property Monitor.What if January 2025 isn’t the end of the boom, but the start of an era of a sustainable market? A market where investors prefer real assets over castles in the air, and developers focus not on quantity, but on quality?As one analyst from Property Monitor aptly put it: “The era of guaranteed double-digit returns is fading, but opportunities remain — for those who know how to spot them.”

Inspired by  Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Vision During Our Dubai Visit Our recent family visit to Dubai left me truly amazed and hashtag#inspired. Standing at the top of hashtag#Burj Khalifa and dining at Atmosphere, I couldn’t help but reflect on how one man’s vision transformed a desert into one of the most sought-after destinations in the world.Sheikh Rashid bin Saeed Al Maktoum’s legacy is not just about the towering skyscrapers or the luxurious lifestyle — it’s about how he uplifted an entire community and positioned Dubai as a global icon.Here are 10 powerful leadership lessons that resonated deeply with me during this trip:✨ 1. Vision Beyond Limitations – Sheikh Rashid envisioned Dubai’s potential even when it was just a small fishing village. Greatness begins with a bold vision.🏆 2. Investing in Infrastructure – From Jebel Ali Port to the expansion of Dubai Creek, his focus on infrastructure laid the foundation for global success.💡 3. Diversification of hashtag#Economy – Moving beyond oil, he built hashtag#Dubai into a hub for trade, tourism, aviation, and real estate — a reminder to never depend on one source of success.✈️ 4. Building Global Connectivity – Dubai’s airports and Emirates Airlines have made it a global transit hub. Connectivity breeds opportunity.🌍 5. Creating a Business-Friendly Environment – Tax-free zones and simplified regulations have made Dubai a magnet for global talent and investments.🏙️ 6. Balancing Tradition with Modernity – Despite its modern skyline, Dubai’s cultural roots remain intact — proof that growth and tradition can coexist.🚀 7. Bold Decision-Making – Projects like hashtag#Palm Jumeirah and Burj Khalifa were once unimaginable — but bold, strategic decisions turned them into reality.🌳 8. Sustainable Development – Sheikh Rashid ensured long-term planning and strategic reserves to future-proof Dubai’s success.🤝 9. Empowering the People – He invested in human capital, empowering people to contribute to Dubai’s success story.🏅 10. Leading with Humility and Service – Despite the immense success, Sheikh Rashid remained humble and connected with his people. True leadership is about serving others.💖 As I stood with my family, overwhelmed by the breathtaking views and the feeling of togetherness, I realized — with vision, courage, and purpose, you can transform the impossible into reality.Dubai is not just a city — it’s a testament to the power of visionary leadership. Have you visited Dubai?Share your experiences!hashtag#Leadership hashtag#Inspiration hashtag#Dubai hashtag#VisionaryLeadership hashtag#LessonsFromDubai hashtag#FamilyMoments HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum HH Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan hashtag#UAE Ishan Sharma

Best Time to Visit UAE for a Job Search!If you’re planning to come to the UAE on a visit visa to find a job, timing is everything! Here’s when you have the highest chances of landing a job:✅ January – April (Peak Hiring Season)Companies have fresh hiring budgets, and recruitment is in full swing! This is one of the best times to apply and attend interviews.✅ September – November (Post-Summer Hiring Surge)After the summer break, businesses resume hiring, and there’s a strong demand for new talent( I personally suggest at post summer periods)🚫 Months to Avoid❌ May – August – The UAE summer slows down recruitment as many decision-makers go on vacation and also it’s Ramadan time!! ❌ December – The holiday season means fewer job openings except for urgent roles.💡 Pro Tip: Start applying before you arrive, network actively , Do courses for relevant work needs and focus on high-demand industries like real estate, tech and marketing…..If you found this helpful, share it with someone who’s planning to job hunt in the UAE 🇦🇪 Always WELCOME 💜hashtag#ganustories

So here we are ... a whole eight weeks in to my time with Kevin McCallum and Polaris Software… and what a ride it’s been.In that time and since the inception of a Group People Team we have...✅ Rolled out group life assurance, rolled out a health care cash plan, rolled out a Cycle to Work scheme, launched income protection✅ Launched a new much more user friendly HRIS & ATS✅ Introduced a People team to the Group who work in sprints ✅ Moved our pension to salary sacrifice✅ Hired 7 incredible new people—from first posting an ad to joining us! For context we've also had over 1,500 applicants since the end of January✅ Aligned holiday entitlements across the Group✅ Supported two colleague-voted charities with important work they do✅ Rolled out Moment in Time days because hey, life milestones are not to be missed✅ Spent HOURS on trains to London, Preston, Sheffield & Banbury (turns out I am quite productive on a train. Thank you Seatfrog 🐸 )✅ Organised a glorious all-company event at The Gherkin✅ Run our first proper eNPS survey and saw a huge uptick in the score. The qualitative data made my heart sing! ✅ Increased group comms with regular Town Halls✅ Seen almost a double in our LinkedIn following✅ Had more human and real conversations than we can shake a stick at! Yes yes there is a strategist in me.. and I know that is loads of clean up - but levelling the bar first is key. The strategy stuff will come & we’re not slowing down… right now, we’re deep in to planning:🔄 OKRs & goal setting📚 Manager training📝 A brand-new employee handbook🌍 Building an intranet⚠️ Health and Safety Compliance🔨 Designs for office face-lifts🌟 Accreditation applicationsThe list keeps growing, but hey—it’s good to be busy, right?Am I tired? Absolutely.Exhausted? 100%.Still feeling sparky? You bet. That's the thing about working in a People team isn't it? There is so much BAU we can't shout about and this is 'just' a list... there are so many more things that Elle Thomas deserves a shout out for that will have to be held for our 1:1s 🌟
